title: Disinhibited Social Engagement Disorder
description: A comprehensive guide to Disinhibited Social Engagement Disorder, including diagnosis, management, and clinical considerations based on DSM-5 criteria.
publicSummary: Disinhibited Social Engagement Disorder is a mental health condition classified in the DSM-5 under Trauma- and Stressor-Related Disorders. This content provides educational information based on current clinical guidelines and is not a substitute for professional medical advice.
